name: Ensure that the --service-account-extend-token-expiration parameter is set to false
description: By default Kubernetes extends service account token lifetimes to one year. This should be set to false for security.
long_description: The `--service-account-extend-token-expiration` parameter controls whether the API Server will extend the lifetime of auto-generated service account tokens beyond the default of one hour. Setting this to false ensures tokens expire according to the shorter default lifetime, reducing the window of opportunity for token misuse if compromised.
remediation:
Edit the API server pod specification file `/etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml` on the Control Plane node and set the below parameter.

```
--service-account-extend-token-expiration=false
```
manual_test:
Run the following command on the Control Plane node:

```
ps -ef | grep kube-apiserver
```

Verify that the `--service-account-extend-token-expiration` argument is set to `false`.
impact_statement: Service account tokens will expire according to the default shorter lifetime. Workloads using long-lived tokens may need to be updated to handle token refresh.
